label: anticlockwise
definition: Describes the apparent direction of the sequential path on a P–T diagram, where the x-axis is temperature, and the y-axis is pressure (with positive ordinates above the abscissa). Anticlockwise P–T paths are those in which the thermal maximum (peak temperature) is reached prior to the peak pressure being attained. These P–T paths generally reflect high (geo)thermal gradient and heat flow conditions.

label: clockwise
definition: Describes the apparent direction of the sequential path on a P–T diagram, where the x-axis is temperature, and the y-axis is pressure (with positive ordinates above the abscissa). Clockwise P–T paths are those in which peak pressure is reached prior to peak temperature being attained. These P–T paths generally reflect burial and subsequent heating under low to intermediate (geo)thermal gradient and heat flow conditions.

label: isobaric
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the pressure (P) remains constant over a period of time (t) during a metamorphic event.

label: isobaric cooling
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the pressure (P) remains constant as temperature decreases (i.e. cooling) over a period of time (t).

label: isobaric heating
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the pressure (P) remains constant as temperature increases (i.e. heating) over a period of time (t).

label: isothermal
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the temperature (T) remains constant over a period of time (t), during a metamorphic event.

label: isothermal pressure decrease
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the temperature (T) remains constant while the pressure decreases over a period of time (t).

label: isothermal pressure increase
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the temperature (T) remains constant while pressure increases over a period of time (t).

label: near-isobaric cooling
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the pressure (P) remains nearly constant over a period of time (t) during a metamorphic cooling event.

label: near-isobaric heating
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the pressure (P) remains nearly constant over a period of time (t) during a metamorphic heating event.

label: near-isothermal compression
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the temperature (T) remains nearly constant over a period of time (t) during a metamorphic compression event.

label: near-isothermal decompression
definition: Metamorphic conditions under which the temperature (T) remains nearly constant over a period of time (t) during a metamorphic decompression event.

label: unknown
definition: The pressure(P)–temperature(T)–time(t) path for a specific metamorphic event is unknown.
